ANU.name: Amy Dawel
expertise: Biological Psychology Neuropsychology Psychopharmacology Physiological Psychology
ANU.biography: I am a cognitive and clinical psychologist. My research examines how people perceive and respond to rapidly changing  social cues in the face—namely facial expressions and eye-gaze. I have a  particular interest in perception of and responses to genuine emotion,  as compared to symbolic or posed facial expressions. My work examines  both the mechanisms and impact of individual differences in these social  cognition abilities, including associations with clinical and  personality traits, using behavioural and EEG technqiues.
